1. Does the group $Z_{41}^{*}$
    a. has a group of order 3?
        - Yes. $|Z_{4}^{*}|=3$, $Z_{4}^{*}$ is a subset of $Z_{41}^{*}$ and is a group since:
          
          G1. $\:\:a, b \in Z_{4}^{*}$; $\: \: a\cdot_{4} b \in Z_{4}^{*}$
          
          G2. $\:\:a, b \:\text{and}\: c \in Z_{4}^{*}$; $\:\: (a \cdot_{4} b) \cdot_{4} c = a \cdot_{4} (b \cdot_{4} c)$
          
$$
\begin{aligned}
&(1 \cdot_{4} 2) \cdot_{4} 3 = 1 \cdot_{4} (2 \cdot_{4} 3)\\
&= c + \phi_i Y_{i-1} \dots
\end{aligned}
$$
